schemas.description: Early Data Release from the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument

tables.description: Summary quantities for every DESI exposure
Quantities obtained when a DESI target is assigned to a fiber
Summary quantities for each petal of the DESI instrument in a given exposure; in normal operation there are ten frames for every exposure
Photometric quantities from LS DR9 for every TARGETID
For a given tile, this table lists all targets that could have received a fiber assignment
The quantities obtained when photometric objects are analyzed in the target selection process
Summary quantities for every DESI tile (pointing on the sky)
Redshift and other quantities for spectra that have been grouped and coadded by HEALPixel
Redshift and other quantities for spectra that have been grouped and coadded by tile

columns.description: Target right ascension
Target declination
Ecliptic longitude
Ecliptic latitude
Galactic longitude
Galactic latitude

Average airmass during this exposure as measured by GFA
Average FWHM atmospheric seeing during this exposure as measured by GFA
Fraction of the flux entering the fiber relative to nominal 1.1 arcsec seeing using the PSF inferred from the GFAs
Fraction of the flux entering the fiber relative to nominal 1.1 arcsec seeing using the PSF inferred from the GFAs for a source with an ELG profile (0.45 arcsec exponential galaxy profile)
Fraction of the flux entering the fiber relative to nominal 1.1 arcsec seeing using the PSF inferred from the GFAs for a source with a BGS profile (deV profile half light radius of 1.5 arcsec)

Fraction of light entering a fiber relative to expectations for 1.1 arcsec seeing, transparency 1, for an object with a PSF profile, measured by comparing the flux integrated over a 107 micron diameter circle on the GFA images centered at the PlateMaker expectations for where stars should land
Same as FIBERFAC_GFA except for an ELG profile
Same as FIBERFAC_GFA except for a BGS profile
Average airmass during this exposure as measured by GFA
Sky background in the GFA passband, measured from the GFA backgrounds
